definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
binding (loanword)/to bind (e.g. an account to a mobile phone number)
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)

sentences.english: Tie to the post of Unconcern the goats of Vice and Virtue.
sentences.chinese: 把惡習與美德兩頭山羊綁在漫不經心的柱子上。

sentences.english: Project that started so that Vittel may tie to music.
sentences.chinese: 項目，開始使維特爾可綁音樂。

sentences.english: But we still can't strap on a jetpack and zoom off to Tesco for our groceries.
sentences.chinese: 只是，我們還不能綁着噴氣揹包去樂購買雜貨。

sentences.english: Ensure that tongs, which are not in use, are hung (tied back) at the side of the floor.
sentences.chinese: 大鉗不用時，一定要把它們綁到鑽臺邊上。

sentences.english: That's why I have this Band-Aid here.
Mahouts, (elephant drivers) tie wooden seats on the elephants' backs, then head into the park.
sentences.chinese: 管象人將木製座椅綁在象背上，然後走向公園。

sentences.english: The Eye is where your leader is threaded and tied.
sentences.chinese: 眼就是穿子線綁着毛鉤的部位。

sentences.english: Pajama pants feature a drawstring waist tie for an easy, adjustable fit.
sentences.chinese: 睡褲功能束帶腰部綁了一個簡單的，可調適合。

sentences.english: The soldiers tied the hands of the defeated king and all of his ministers.
sentences.chinese: 士兵將這位戰敗國王和他所有大臣的手都綁了起來。

sentences.english: Instead, they tied our feet together.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我們的腳綁在一起。

sentences.english: I want to sleep in the infirmary where you were splinted .
sentences.chinese: 我想睡在你被金屬片綁着的醫療所。

sentences.english: Then he took up the oar with the knife lashed to it.
sentences.chinese: 然後他拿起上面綁着刀子的槳。

sentences.english: Now I must prepare the nooses and the rope to lash him alongside, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 現在我得準備好套索和繩子，把它綁在船邊，他想。

sentences.english: It binds us together and is a great comfort, ” said Piman Limpaphayom, who runs the MBA programme at Sasin Business School in Bangkok.
sentences.chinese: 它把我們綁在了一起，是一種巨大的安慰。

sentences.english: The dynamite and the fuses are strapped along sticks of bamboo before being shoved into pre-drilled holes.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈和引信綁在長竹竿上，放入事先磚好的洞裏。

sentences.english: They would tie and raft their boats up to have party.
sentences.chinese: 他們將把他們的小船綁在一起，紮成筏子舉行聚會。

definition: to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
